metadata.longDescription:
As a system engineer, you can deploy a Red Hat Process Automation Manager environment on Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform to provide an infrastructure to develop or execute processes and other business assets.
Make sure the required ImageStreamTags exist in the openshift project. See below for the required images

plans.name: trial
plans.description: Deploy an ephemeral environment for testing Business Central and Process Server. A default `adminUser` user will be created with the `RedHat` password. In case the generated routes need to be overridden, it is possible to set custom routes for both applications.

apb_businesscentral_hostname.description: Public hostname for Business Central. Generated if empty
apb_businesscentral_hostname.title: Business Central Public Hostname

apb_image_stream_tag.description: Tag version of the ImageStream to use. It must exist in the openshift namespace.
apb_image_stream_tag.title: Image version

apb_kieserver_hostname.description: Public hostname for Process Server. Generated if empty
apb_kieserver_hostname.title: Process Server Public Hostname

plans.name: authoring
plans.description: An environment for creating and modifying processes using Business Central. It consists of pods that provide Business Central for the authoring work and a Process Server for test execution of the processes.

openshift_form_definition.title: External Database (only if Database type is External)

apb_auth_use_rolemapper.description: Provide a properties file defining the roles to map
apb_auth_use_rolemapper.title: Map roles

apb_sso_url.description: Red Hat Single Sign-On (SSO) URL. Leave empty to avoid using SSO. For example, https://rhsso.example.com/auth
apb_sso_url.title: RH-SSO URL

apb_sso_realm.description: Red Hat Single Sign-On Realm name. For example, rhpam
apb_sso_realm.title: RH-SSO Realm

apb_sso_businesscentral_client.description: Red Hat Single Sign-On Client name for Business Central. If the secret, user and password are provided it will be created. For example, businesscentral
apb_sso_businesscentral_client.title: RH-SSO Business Central - Client

apb_sso_businesscentral_client_secret.description: Red Hat Single Sign-On Client secret for Business Central.
apb_sso_businesscentral_client_secret.title: RH-SSO Business Central - Client Secret

apb_kieserver_sso_client.description: Red Hat Single Sign-On Client name for Process Server. If the secret, user and password are provided it will be created. For example, kieserver
apb_kieserver_sso_client.title: RH-SSO Process Server - Client

apb_kieserver_sso_client_secret.description: Red Hat Single Sign-On Client secret for Process Server.
apb_kieserver_sso_client_secret.title: RH-SSO Process Server - Client Secret

apb_sso_user.description: Red Hat Single Sign-On User to be used to create the Client if it doesn't exist. The user must be able to create secrets on the given realm.
apb_sso_user.title: RH-SSO Admin User

apb_sso_pwd.description: Red Hat Single Sign-On Password to use to create the Client if it doesn't exist.
apb_sso_pwd.title: RH-SSO Admin Password

apb_sso_disable_ssl_cert_validation.description: Disable SSL Certificate Validation when connecting to RH-SSO
apb_sso_disable_ssl_cert_validation.title: RH-SSO Disable SSL Validation

apb_sso_principal_attribute.description: Principal attribute to use as username
apb_sso_principal_attribute.title: RH-SSO Principal Attribute

apb_auth_ldap_url.description: LDAP Endpoint to connect for authentication. e.g. "ldap://myldap.example.com"
apb_auth_ldap_url.title: LDAP Endpoint

apb_auth_ldap_bind_dn.description: Bind DN used for authentication. e.g. "uid=admin,ou=users,ou=exmample,ou=com"
apb_auth_ldap_bind_dn.title: LDAP Bind DN

apb_auth_ldap_jaas_security_domain.description: The JMX ObjectName of the JaasSecurityDomain used to decrypt the password.
apb_auth_ldap_jaas_security_domain.title: LDAP JAAS Security Domain

apb_auth_ldap_base_ctx_dn.description: LDAP Base DN of the top-level context to begin the user search. e.g. "ou=users,ou=example,ou=com"
apb_auth_ldap_base_ctx_dn.title: LDAP Base DN

apb_auth_ldap_base_filter.description: LDAP search filter used to locate the context of the user to authenticate. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. A common example for the search filter is (uid={0}).
apb_auth_ldap_base_filter.title: LDAP Base Search filter

apb_auth_ldap_search_time_limit.description: The timeout in milliseconds for user or role searches. e.g. "10000"
apb_auth_ldap_search_time_limit.title: LDAP Search time limit

apb_auth_ldap_distinguished_name_attribu.description: The name of the attribute in the user entry that contains the DN of the user. This may be necessary if the DN of the user itself contains special characters, backslash for example, that prevent correct user mapping. If the attribute does not exist, the entry’s DN is used.
apb_auth_ldap_distinguished_name_attribu.title: LDAP DN attribute

apb_auth_ldap_parse_username.description: A flag indicating if the DN is to be parsed for the username. If set to true, the DN is parsed for the username. If set to false the DN is not parsed for the username. This option is used together with usernameBeginString and usernameEndString.
apb_auth_ldap_parse_username.title: LDAP Parse username

apb_auth_ldap_username_begin_string.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the start of the DN to reveal the username. This option is used together with usernameEndString and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.
apb_auth_ldap_username_begin_string.title: LDAP Username begin string

apb_auth_ldap_username_end_string.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the end of the DN to reveal the username. This option is used together with usernameEndString and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.
apb_auth_ldap_username_end_string.title: LDAP Username end string

apb_auth_ldap_role_attribute_id.description: Name of the attribute containing the user roles. e.g. "memberOf"
apb_auth_ldap_role_attribute_id.title: LDAP Role attributeID

apb_auth_ldap_roles_ctx_dn.description: The fixed DN of the context to search for user roles. This is not the DN where the actual roles are, but the DN where the objects containing the user roles are. For example, in a Microsoft Active Directory server, this is the DN where the user account is.
apb_auth_ldap_roles_ctx_dn.title: LDAP Roles Search DN

apb_auth_ldap_role_filter.description: A search filter used to locate the roles associated with the authenticated user. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. The authenticated userDN is substituted into the filter anywhere a {1} is used. An example search filter that matches on the input username is (member={0}). An alternative that matches on the authenticated userDN is (member={1}).
apb_auth_ldap_role_filter.title: LDAP Role search filter

apb_auth_ldap_role_recursion.description: The number of levels of recursion the role search will go below a matching context. Disable recursion by setting this to 0.
apb_auth_ldap_role_recursion.title: LDAP Role recursion

apb_auth_ldap_default_role.description: A role included for all authenticated users
apb_auth_ldap_default_role.title: LDAP Default role

apb_auth_ldap_role_name_attribute_id.description: Name of the attribute within the roleCtxDN context which contains the role name. If the roleAttributeIsDN property is set to true, this property is used to find the role object’s name attribute.
apb_auth_ldap_role_name_attribute_id.title: LDAP Role name attribute ID

apb_auth_ldap_parse_role_name_from_dn.description: A flag indicating if the DN returned by a query contains the roleNameAttributeID. If set to true, the DN is checked for the roleNameAttributeID. If set to false, the DN is not checked for the roleNameAttributeID. This flag can improve the performance of LDAP queries.
apb_auth_ldap_parse_role_name_from_dn.title: LDAP Role DN contains roleNameAttributeID

apb_auth_ldap_referral_user_attribute_id.description: If you are not using referrals, this option can be ignored. When using referrals, this option denotes the attribute name which contains users defined for a certain role, for example member, if the role object is inside the referral. Users are checked against the content of this attribute name. If this option is not set, the check will always fail, so role objects cannot be stored in a referral tree.
apb_auth_ldap_referral_user_attribute_id.title: LDAP Referral user attribute ID

apb_auth_role_mapper_replace_role.description: Whether to add to the current roles, or replace the current roles with the mapped ones. Replaces if set to true.
apb_auth_role_mapper_replace_role.title: RoleMapping replaceRole property

apb_auth_role_mapper_roles_properties.description: When present, the RoleMapping Login Module will be configured to use the provided file. This property defines the fully-qualified file path and name of a properties file or resource which maps roles to replacement roles. The format is original_role=role1,role2,role3
apb_auth_role_mapper_roles_properties.title: RoleMapping rolesProperties file path

apb_auth_ldap_role_attribute_is_dn.description: Whether or not the roleAttributeID contains the fully-qualified DN of a role object. If false, the role name is taken from the value of the roleNameAttributeId attribute of the context name. Certain directory schemas, such as Microsoft Active Directory, require this attribute to be set to true.
apb_auth_ldap_role_attribute_is_dn.title: LDAP Role Attribute ID is DN

apb_auth_type.description: Provider to use for authentication and authorization
apb_auth_type.title: Athentication provider

apb_businesscentral_hostname.description: Public hostname for Business Central. Generated if empty
apb_businesscentral_hostname.title: Public Hostname

apb_businesscentral_keystore_alias.description: Name of the certificate alias included in the keystore to be used by the server to accept HTTPS connections. If a secret name is not provided, the server generates a seret with this alias.
apb_businesscentral_keystore_alias.title: Keystore certificate alias

apb_businesscentral_keystore_name.description: Name of the keystore file containing the certificate to be used by the server to accept HTTPS connections. If a secret name is not provided, the server generates a secret with this keystore file name.
apb_businesscentral_keystore_name.title: Keystore File Name

apb_businesscentral_keystore_pwd.description: Password protecting both the Keystore and the Certificate. Generated if empty
apb_businesscentral_keystore_pwd.title: Keystore and Certificate Password

apb_businesscentral_maven_repo_pwd.description: Password to use to interact with the Business Central Maven repository. Generated if empty
apb_businesscentral_maven_repo_pwd.title: Maven Repository Password

apb_businesscentral_maven_repo_user.description: Username to use to interact with the Business Central Maven repository.
apb_businesscentral_maven_repo_user.title: Maven Repository Username

apb_businesscentral_secret_name.description: Name of the secret containing the keystore to be used by the server to accept HTTPS connections. Generated if empty
apb_businesscentral_secret_name.title: Secret Name

apb_businesscentral_volume_size.description: Specify the Persistent Volume Claim size to create for storing the Workspace. For example, 1Gi
apb_businesscentral_volume_size.title: Workspace Storage Size

apb_controller_pwd.description: User password to access the Controller. Generated if empty.
apb_controller_pwd.title: Controller Password

apb_git_hooks_dir.description: The directory to use for git hooks, if required. e.g. /opt/eap/standalone/data/kie/git/hooks
apb_git_hooks_dir.title: Git hooks directory

apb_image_stream_tag.description: Tag version of the ImageStream to use. It must exist in the openshift namespace.
apb_image_stream_tag.title: Image version

apb_kie_admin_pwd.description: Admin user password for Business Central and Process Server. Generated if empty
apb_kie_admin_pwd.title: Admin Password

apb_kie_admin_user.description: Admin user name for Business Central and Process Server
apb_kie_admin_user.title: Admin Username

apb_kieserver_db_size.description: Persistent Volume Claim size to create for the Database. For example, 1Gi. Ignored if External is selected
apb_kieserver_db_size.title: Database Storage Size

apb_kieserver_db_type.description: Database Type to persist the Process Server runtime information. DO NOT USE H2 for deploying more than 1 instance of Process Server. For H2, PostgreSQL, and MySQL the database server will be deployed in a pod. To use a database server that is deployed elsewhere, select External.
apb_kieserver_db_type.title: Database Type

apb_kieserver_external_db_dialect.description: Hibernate dialect class to use. Required for External database. For example, org.hibernate.dialect.MySQL5Dialect
apb_kieserver_external_db_dialect.title: Dialect class

apb_kieserver_external_db_driver.description: Database driver type. Required for External database. For example, mysql or postgresql
apb_kieserver_external_db_driver.title: Driver name

apb_kieserver_external_db_host.description: External database server host. Required for External database. For example, 127.0.0.1
apb_kieserver_external_db_host.title: Host

apb_kieserver_external_db_name.description: External Database name. Required for External database. For example, rhpam
apb_kieserver_external_db_name.title: Database Name

apb_kieserver_external_db_port.description: External database server port. Required for External database. For example, 3306
apb_kieserver_external_db_port.title: Port

apb_kieserver_external_db_url.description: External database server JDBC URL. Required for External database. For example, jdbc:mysql:127.0.0.1:3306/rhpam
apb_kieserver_external_db_url.title: Database JDBC URL

apb_kieserver_hostname.description: Public hostname for Process Server. Generated if empty
apb_kieserver_hostname.title: Public Hostname

apb_kieserver_image_stream_name.description: Image Stream Name to use for Process Server. If you have generated a custom image (for example, to provide a database server driver), you can change this parameter to use it.
apb_kieserver_image_stream_name.title: Process Server Image Stream Name

apb_kieserver_keystore_alias.description: Name of the certificate alias included in the keystore to be used by the server to accept HTTPS connections. If a secret name is not provided, the server generates a seret with this alias.
apb_kieserver_keystore_alias.title: Keystore certificate alias

apb_kieserver_keystore_name.description: Name of the keystore file containing the certificate to be used by the server to accept HTTPS connections. If a secret name is not provided, the server generates a secret with this keystore file name.
apb_kieserver_keystore_name.title: Keystore File Name

apb_kieserver_keystore_pwd.description: Password protecting both the Keystore and the Certificate. Generated if empty
apb_kieserver_keystore_pwd.title: Keystore and Certificate Password

apb_kieserver_pwd.description: User password to interact with the Process Server using the REST API. Generated if empty
apb_kieserver_pwd.title: Process Server Password

apb_kieserver_secret_name.description: Name of the secret containing the keystore to be used by the server to accept HTTPS connections. Generated if empty
apb_kieserver_secret_name.title: Secret Name

apb_kieserver_user.description: User to interact with the Process Server using the REST API
apb_kieserver_user.title: Process Server Username

apb_maven_repo_pwd.description: Password to use to interact with the external Maven repository.
apb_maven_repo_pwd.title: Maven Repository Password

apb_maven_repo_url.description: External Maven Repository URL. Leave empty to use the repository provided by Business Central
apb_maven_repo_url.title: Maven Repository URL

apb_maven_repo_user.description: Username to use to interact with the external Maven repository.
apb_maven_repo_user.title: Maven Repository Username

plans.name: immutable-kie
plans.description: In this environment, when you deploy a Process Server pod, it builds an image that loads and starts a process or group of processes. You cannot stop any process on the pod or add any new process to the pod. If you want to use another version of a process or modify the configuration in any other way, you deploy a new server image and displace the old one.
